conversation.content: Track my grades across classes and show what I need to score on remaining assignments to hit my target GPA.

content.text:
Great—I'll help you track each class and show exactly what you need on remaining assignments to hit your target GPA. To get this dialed in, please share:

- Your current cumulative GPA and total credits completed
- Your target GPA
- Your classes this term (name and credit hours)
- For each class: grading scheme (points/percentage/weighted categories) and the assignments (title, category, weight or points possible, due date, status, and any scores so far)

If you prefer, I can work with approximate info now and you can refine it later.

Once I have those, I will:
- Compute your current per-class grades and category breakdowns
- Show remaining assignment weights and due dates
- Calculate the minimum scores needed on upcoming items to reach your target class grades and overall GPA
- Provide what‑if sliders so you can tweak future scores and immediately see the projected GPA

You can also adjust your target GPA anytime with the gauge below. When you send your class and assignment details, I’ll populate everything automatically.

For an even split that’s Exam 2 ≥167/200, Final ≥208/250, Project ≥83/100, Remaining quizzes ≥42/50 total (≈8–9 each). Earned subtotal ≈ 62.2%. - Need to reach 90% overall: Remaining weight is Final 20% + 2 Quizzes 5% + 2 HW 4% = 29%. Option B (balanced across all remaining items): If you score the same on Final, both Quizzes, and both HW, you need ≈ 95.9% on each remaining item. Intro to Psychology (points out of 1000; target A ≥ 930/1000) - Completed: 430/500 (86%). Remaining: 600 points (Exam 2 = 200, Final = 250, Project = 100, Quizzes = 50 total). - To reach 930 total, you need 500/600 = 83.33% average on what’s left.
